t: Genesis 49
Israel’s Prophecy concerning His Sons
Then*p Jacob summoned his sons and said, “Assemble yourselves that I may tell you what will befall you in the days to come.
Gather*pn together and hear, O sons of Jacob; And*ln listen to Israel your father.
“Reuben,*ln you are my firstborn; My*ln might and the beginning of my strength, Preeminent*ln in dignity and preeminent in power.
Uncontrolled*ln as water, you shall not have preeminence, Because*ln you went up to your father’s bed; Then*ln you defiled it*i —he went up to my couch.
“Simeon*ln and Levi are brothers; Their*ln swords are implements of violence.
Let*ln my soul not enter into their council; Let*ln not my glory be united with their assembly; Because*ln in their anger they slew men, And*ln in their self-will they lamed oxen.
Cursed*ln be their anger, for it is fierce; And*ln their wrath, for it is cruel. I*ln will disperse them in Jacob, And*ln scatter them in Israel.
“Judah,*ln your brothers shall praise you; Your*ln hand shall be on the neck of your enemies; Your*ln father’s sons shall bow down to you.
Judah*ln is a lion’s whelp; From*ln the prey, my son, you have gone up. He*ln couches, he lies down as a lion, And*ln as a lion, who dares rouse him up?
The*ln scepter shall not depart from Judah, Nor*ln the ruler’s staff from between his feet, Until*ln Shiloh comes, And*ln to him shall*i be*i the obedience of the peoples.
He*ln ties his*i foal to the vine, And*ln his donkey’s colt to the choice vine; He*ln washes his garments in wine, And*ln his robes in the blood of grapes.
His*ln eyes are dull from wine, And*ln his teeth white from milk.
“Zebulun*ln will dwell at the seashore; And*ln he shall*i be*i a haven for ships, And*ln his flank shall*i be*i toward Sidon.
“Issachar*ln is a strong donkey, Lying*ln down between the sheepfolds.
When*ln he saw that a resting place was good And*ln that the land was pleasant, He*ln bowed his shoulder to bear burdens,*i And*ln became a slave at forced labor.
“Dan*ln shall judge his people, As*ln one of the tribes of Israel.
Dan*ln shall be a serpent in the way, A*ln horned snake in the path, That*ln bites the horse’s heels, So*ln that his rider falls backward.
For*ln Your salvation I wait, O Lord.*s
“As*ln for Gad, raiders shall raid him, But*ln he will raid at*i their heels.
“As*ln for Asher, his food shall be rich, And*ln he will yield royal dainties.
“Naphtali*ln is a doe let loose, He*ln gives beautiful words.
“Joseph*ln is a fruitful bough, A*ln fruitful bough by a spring; Its*iln branches run over a wall.
The*ln archers bitterly attacked him, And*ln shot at*i him*i and harassed him;
But*ln his bow remained firm, And*ln his arms were agile, From*ln the hands of the Mighty One of Jacob (From*ln there is the Shepherd, the Stone of Israel),

From*ln the God of your father who helps you, And*ln by the Almighty who blesses you With*iln blessings of heaven above, Blessings*ln of the deep that lies beneath, Blessings*ln of the breasts and of the womb.

The*ln blessings of your father Have*ln surpassed the blessings of my ancestors Up*ln to the utmost bound of the everlasting hills; May*ln they be on the head of Joseph, And*ln on the crown of the head of the one distinguished among his brothers.
“Benjamin*ln is a ravenous wolf; In*ln the morning he devours the prey, And*ln in the evening he divides the spoil.”
All*p these are the twelve tribes of Israel, and this is what their father said to them when he blessed them. He blessed them, every one with the blessing appropriate to him.
Then he charged them and said to them, “I am about to be gathered to my people; bury me with my fathers in the cave that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
in the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, which is before Mamre, in the land of Canaan, which Abraham bought along with the field from Ephron the Hittite for a burial site.
There they buried Abraham and his wife Sarah, there they buried Isaac and his wife Rebekah, and there I buried Leah—
the field and the cave that is in it, purchased from the sons of Heth.”
When Jacob finished charging his sons, he drew his feet into the bed and breathed his last, and was gathered to his people.
